PCTR questions

Source: vignettes/articles/pctr-questions.Rmd
pctr-questions.Rmd

Here I ask the questions I have when I characterize the PCTR data and code.

library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = TRUE)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(tiltIndicator)

packageVersion("tiltIndicator")
#> [1] '0.0.0.9019'

1. Joining by redundant columns

Questions:

  • 1.1. We call inner_join() with by = c("activity_product_uuid", "ei_activity", "unit") and Tilman suggested we might remove "ei_activity" and "unit". Do we expect them to be always redundant with the groups defined by "activity_product_uuid" alone? Or do you mean they are redundant in this specific toy dataset?

2. Edge case with too few co2 data and a single company

pctr_score_copmanies() returns 3 rows for each company (regardless the number of rows per company). This seems expected.

one_company <- pctr_companies |> filter(company_id %in% first(company_id))
one_company
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#>   activity_product_uuid                             company_id ei_activity unit 
#>   <chr>                                             <chr>      <chr>       <chr>
#> 1 0a242b09-772a-5edf-8e82-9cb4ba52a258_ae39ee61-d4… powerstar… transport,… metr…
#> 2 be06d25c-73dc-55fb-965b-0f300453e380_98b48ff2-22… powerstar… treatment … kg   
#> 3 977d997e-c257-5033-ba39-d0edeeef4ba2_0ace02fa-ec… powerstar… market gro… metr…
#> 4 5fd7fca0-0700-51fd-877a-72b5b6ff8868_9219c94a-7a… powerstar… treatment … kg

pctr_ecoinvent_co2 |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(one_company)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high       0.25       0.5            0.5 
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…      0.25       0.25           0.25
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low        0.5        0.25           0.25

another_company <- pctr_companies |> filter(company_id %in% last(company_id))
two_companies <- bind_rows(one_company, another_company)
two_companies
#> # A tibble: 20 × 4
#>    activity_product_uuid                            company_id ei_activity unit 
#>    <chr>                                            <chr>      <chr>       <chr>
#>  1 0a242b09-772a-5edf-8e82-9cb4ba52a258_ae39ee61-d… powerstar… transport,… metr…

#>  3 977d997e-c257-5033-ba39-d0edeeef4ba2_0ace02fa-e… powerstar… market gro… metr…

#> 15 164ce725-4895-548e-84b4-3103aec0f8ab_6c8d3210-3… mbdgmbh_0… yarn produ… kg   
#> 16 d8f0cc89-f688-5151-8393-c039c71f1ed5_f31d1245-8… mbdgmbh_0… photovolta… m2

pctr_ecoinvent_co2 |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(two_companies)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high       0.25      0.5           0.5   
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…      0.25      0.25          0.25  
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low        0.5       0.25          0.25  
#> 4 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            high       0.25      0.438         0.688 
#> 5 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            medi…      0.5       0.375         0.25  
#> 6 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            low        0.25      0.188         0.0625

But the number number of rows in the co2 data can be such that the output seems useless and you get no warning.

one_company <- pctr_companies |> filter(company_id %in% first(company_id))
one_company
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#>   activity_product_uuid                             company_id ei_activity unit 
#>   <chr>                                             <chr>      <chr>       <chr>
#> 1 0a242b09-772a-5edf-8e82-9cb4ba52a258_ae39ee61-d4… powerstar… transport,… metr…
#> 2 be06d25c-73dc-55fb-965b-0f300453e380_98b48ff2-22… powerstar… treatment … kg   
#> 3 977d997e-c257-5033-ba39-d0edeeef4ba2_0ace02fa-ec… powerstar… market gro… metr…
#> 4 5fd7fca0-0700-51fd-877a-72b5b6ff8868_9219c94a-7a… powerstar… treatment … kg

too_few_co2_rows <- pctr_ecoinvent_co2 |> slice(1)
too_few_co2_rows
#> # A tibble: 1 × 5
#>   co2_footprint sec       unit          activity_product_uuid        ei_activity
#>           <dbl> <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                        <chr>      
#> 1          4.33 Transport metric ton*km 0a242b09-772a-5edf-8e82-9cb… transport,…

too_few_co2_rows |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(one_company)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high          1          1              1
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…         0          0              0
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low           0          0              0

Questions:

  • 2.1. Is this output useful?
  • 2.2. Should we allow this output with a warning or throw an error and stop?

3. Edge case with too few co2 data and multiple companies

The case above gets much worse with multiple companies because some of them dissapear from the output with no warning.

one_company |> distinct(company_id)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   company_id                                         
#>   <chr>                                              
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_00000005460100827307001
too_few_co2_rows |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(one_company)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high          1          1              1
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…         0          0              0
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low           0          0              0

two_companies |> distinct(company_id)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 1
#>   company_id                                         
#>   <chr>                                              
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_00000005460100827307001
#> 2 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001
too_few_co2_rows |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(two_companies)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high          1          1              1
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…         0          0              0
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low           0          0              0

all_companies <- pctr_companies
all_companies |> distinct(company_id)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 1
#>   company_id                                         
#>   <chr>                                              
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_00000005460100827307001
#> 2 ebtor_00000005324899621837001                      
#> 3 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001
too_few_co2_rows |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(all_companies)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high          1          1              1
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…         0          0              0
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low           0          0              0

Questions:

  • 3.1. Is this a bug or is it expected behaviour?
  • 3.2. Should we throw a warning and continue or throw an error and stop?

4. The boundary case

When the number of rows in the co2 data is 10 or more, we get what we expect.

# Surprising
two_companies |> distinct(company_id)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 1
#>   company_id                                         
#>   <chr>                                              
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_00000005460100827307001
#> 2 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001
pctr_ecoinvent_co2 |>
  slice(1:9) |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(two_companies)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high        0         0.5             0.5
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…       0.5       0.25            0.5
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low         0.5       0.25            0

# Expected
two_companies |> distinct(company_id)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 1
#>   company_id                                         
#>   <chr>                                              
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_00000005460100827307001
#> 2 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001
pctr_ecoinvent_co2 |>
  slice(1:10) |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(two_companies)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high       0.25       0.5             0.5
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…      0.25       0.25            0.5
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low        0.5        0.25            0  
#> 4 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            high       0          0               0  
#> 5 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            medi…      1          1               1  
#> 6 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            low        0          0               0

# Expected
all_companies |> distinct(company_id)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 1
#>   company_id                                         
#>   <chr>                                              
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_00000005460100827307001
#> 2 ebtor_00000005324899621837001                      
#> 3 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001
pctr_ecoinvent_co2 |>
  slice(1:10) |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(all_companies)
#> # A tibble: 9 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high       0.25       0.5             0.5
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…      0.25       0.25            0.5
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low        0.5        0.25            0  
#> 4 ebtor_00000005324899621837001        high       0.6        0.6             0.8
#> 5 ebtor_00000005324899621837001        medi…      0.4        0.4             0.2
#> 6 ebtor_00000005324899621837001        low        0          0               0  
#> 7 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            high       0          0               0  
#> 8 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            medi…      1          1               1  
#> 9 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            low        0          0               0

# Expected
all_companies |> distinct(company_id)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 1
#>   company_id                                         
#>   <chr>                                              
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_00000005460100827307001
#> 2 ebtor_00000005324899621837001                      
#> 3 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001
pctr_ecoinvent_co2 |>
  slice(1:15) |>
  pctr_score_activities() |>
  pctr_score_companies(all_companies)
#> # A tibble: 9 × 5
#>   company_id                           score share_all share_unit share_unit_sec
#>   <chr>                                <chr>     <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… high      0.25       0.5            0.5  
#> 2 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… medi…     0.25       0.25           0.5  
#> 3 powerstartmanufacturinggmbh_0000000… low       0.5        0.25           0    
#> 4 ebtor_00000005324899621837001        high      0.6        0.6            0.8  
#> 5 ebtor_00000005324899621837001        medi…     0.4        0.4            0.2  
#> 6 ebtor_00000005324899621837001        low       0          0              0    
#> 7 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            high      0.167      0.5            0.667
#> 8 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            medi…     0.5        0.333          0.167
#> 9 mbdgmbh_00000004773428001            low       0.333      0.167          0.167

Questions:

  • 4.1. Why 10?
  • 4.2. Can/should we reduce the co2 data to exactly 10 rows?
